intro: Sidastrum, commonly known as the silverleaf tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that often have a silvery or whitish underside. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Sidastrum species are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. They are often grown as ornamental plants due to their attractive foliage and showy blooms.
